content: @Jujian Zhang would you like to try to prove the converse of your exact_of_exact_functor as part of this PR as well?
I think we already have in mathlib that faithful functor that preserves zero morphism reflects exactness.
Oh, you meant that if a functor preserves exactness then it preserves finite limits and colimits.

Markus Himmel said:

We are about to get a much stronger statement: a functor between additive categories that preserves kernels preserves finite limits (note that the functor does not need to be additive). Jakob von Raumer did this for abelian categories in #14026 and he will be able to generalize it to additive categories once #14452 is merged.

I think I will wait for this result to prove the converse.
